titleStmt.title: Our trust against trouble very expedient for the time, composed for our better consolation and consideration of these crosses of warre, lately attempted, and still intended against vs : with diuers speciall prayers and meditations, very requisite to be remembred of vs, before, in and after the time of our trouble / by Charles Gybbon.
titleStmt.author: Gibbon, Charles, fl. 1589-1604.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Charlewood, dwelling in Barbican at the signe of the Halfe Eagle and the Key, and are there to be solde,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: tightly bound, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Lambeth Palace Library.
